Package aima.core.robotics

Interface IMclMap<P extends IMclPose<P,​V,​M>,​V extends IMclVector,​M extends IMclMove<M>,​R extends IMclRangeReading<R,​V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - a pose implementing IMclPose.
    V - an n-1-dimensional vector implementing IMclVector, where n is the dimensionality of the environment.
    M - a movement (or sequence of movements) of the robot, implementing IMclMove.
    R - a range measurement, implementing IMclRangeReading.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MclCartesianPlot2D
    public interface IMclMap<P extends IMclPose<P,​V,​M>,​V extends IMclVector,​M extends IMclMove<M>,​R extends IMclRangeReading<R,​V>>
    This interface defines functionality for a map of an environment for a robot (agent) to perform Monte-Carlo-Localization in.
    Author:
    Arno von Borries, Jan Phillip Kretzschmar, Andreas Walscheid

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean isPoseValid​(P pose)
      Verifies whether a pose is valid, that is inside the map boundaries and not within an obstacle.
      P randomPose()
      Generates a random valid pose on the map.
      R rayCast​(P pose)
      Calculates the length of a ray in a direction defined by a pose.

    • Method Detail

      • randomPose

        P randomPose()
        Generates a random valid pose on the map.
        Returns:
        a random valid pose on the map.

      • rayCast

        R rayCast​(P pose)
        Calculates the length of a ray in a direction defined by a pose.
        Parameters:
        pose - the pose from which the ray is to be cast.
        Returns:
        the length of the ray as a range reading.

      • isPoseValid

        boolean isPoseValid​(P pose)
        Verifies whether a pose is valid, that is inside the map boundaries and not within an obstacle.
        Parameters:
        pose - the pose which is to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the pose is valid.
